Name: Kruger National Park
Description: One of Africa's largest game reserves, home to the Big Five.

Name: Table Mountain National Park
Description: Includes Table Mountain, Cape of Good Hope, and Silvermine.

Name: Garden Route National Park
Description: Combines Tsitsikamma, Knysna, and Wilderness areas.

Name: Kgalagadi Transfrontier Park
Description: Transfrontier park shared with Botswana, known for Kalahari lions.

Name: Addo Elephant National Park
Description: Home to over 600 elephants and the Big Seven.

Name: Pilanesberg National Park
Description: Located in an extinct volcanic crater.

Name: Hluhluwe-Imfolozi Park
Description: Oldest proclaimed nature reserve in Africa, home to white rhinos.

Name: Maasai Mara National Reserve
Description: Famous for the Great Migration and big cat populations.

Name: Amboseli National Park
Description: Known for large elephant herds with Mount Kilimanjaro backdrop.

Name: Tsavo East National Park
Description: One of Kenya's largest parks, home to red elephants.

Name: Tsavo West National Park
Description: Known for Mzima Springs and diverse wildlife.

Name: Nairobi National Park
Description: World's only national park within a capital city.

Name: Hell's Gate National Park
Description: Known for geothermal activity and rock climbing.

Name: Aberdare National Park
Description: Mountainous park with diverse wildlife and waterfalls.

Name: Serengeti National Park
Description: Famous for the annual wildebeest migration of over 1.5 million animals.

Name: Ngorongoro Conservation Area
Description: UNESCO World Heritage Site with the largest intact caldera.

Name: Kilimanjaro National Park
Description: Home to Mount Kilimanjaro, Africa's highest peak.

Name: Tarangire National Park
Description: Known for large elephant herds and baobab trees.

Name: Lake Manyara National Park
Description: Famous for tree-climbing lions and diverse birdlife.

Name: Arusha National Park
Description: Small park with Mount Meru and diverse wildlife.

Name: Ruaha National Park
Description: Tanzania's largest national park, known for elephants and wild dogs.

Name: Chobe National Park
Description: Renowned for large elephant herds and diverse wildlife along the Chobe River.

Name: Okavango Delta
Description: UNESCO World Heritage Site, world's largest inland delta.

Name: Moremi Game Reserve
Description: First reserve in Africa established by local residents.

Name: Kgalagadi Transfrontier Park
Description: Transfrontier park shared with South Africa, Kalahari desert ecosystem.

Name: Etosha National Park
Description: Centered around a vast salt pan, home to diverse wildlife including rhinos and lions.

Name: Namib-Naukluft National Park
Description: One of the largest national parks in Africa, includes Sossusvlei dunes.

Name: Fish River Canyon Park
Description: Home to the second largest canyon in the world.

Name: Skeleton Coast National Park
Description: Famous for shipwrecks and desert-adapted wildlife.

Name: South Luangwa National Park
Description: Known for walking safaris and high density of leopards.

Name: Lower Zambezi National Park
Description: Beautiful park along the Zambezi River with excellent game viewing.

Name: Kafue National Park
Description: Zambia's largest national park, diverse ecosystems.

Name: Hwange National Park
Description: Zimbabwe's largest national park, home to one of the largest elephant populations.

Name: Mana Pools National Park
Description: UNESCO World Heritage Site, known for walking safaris and large mammals.

Name: Matobo National Park
Description: Known for balancing rocks and ancient rock art.

Name: Bwindi Impenetrable National Park
Description: UNESCO World Heritage Site, home to half of the world's mountain gorillas.

Name: Mgahinga Gorilla National Park
Description: Part of the Virunga Conservation Area, home to mountain gorillas.

Name: Queen Elizabeth National Park
Description: Uganda's most visited park, diverse ecosystems and wildlife.

Name: Murchison Falls National Park
Description: Home to the powerful Murchison Falls and diverse wildlife.

Name: Volcanoes National Park
Description: Home to mountain gorillas, made famous by Dian Fossey.

Name: Akagera National Park
Description: Rwanda's only savannah park, home to the Big Five.

Name: Nyungwe Forest National Park
Description: Ancient montane rainforest, home to chimpanzees and colobus monkeys.

Name: Simien Mountains National Park
Description: UNESCO World Heritage Site, home to gelada baboons and Ethiopian wolves.

Name: Bale Mountains National Park
Description: Home to the largest population of Ethiopian wolves and mountain nyala.

Name: Awash National Park
Description: First national park in Ethiopia, diverse wildlife and landscapes.

Name: Toubkal National Park
Description: Home to Mount Toubkal, North Africa's highest peak.

Name: Ifrane National Park
Description: Known for Atlas cedar forests and Barbary macaques.

Name: Ras Mohammed National Park
Description: Marine park at the tip of the Sinai Peninsula, world-class diving.

Name: White Desert National Park
Description: Famous for white chalk rock formations shaped by wind erosion.

Name: Andasibe-Mantadia National Park
Description: Known for indri lemurs and lush rainforests.

Name: Isalo National Park
Description: Known for dramatic sandstone formations and canyons.

Name: Ranomafana National Park
Description: Tropical rainforest park, home to 12 species of lemurs.

Name: Loango National Park
Description: Dubbed "Africa's Last Eden," unique blend of rainforest and ocean ecosystems.

Name: Ivindo National Park
Description: UNESCO World Heritage Site, home to Kongou Falls and diverse wildlife.

Name: Waza National Park
Description: UNESCO Biosphere Reserve, home to lions, elephants, and various bird species.

Name: Korup National Park
Description: One of Africa's oldest and most biodiverse rainforests.
